overview: From 2025-12-18 to 2025-12-19, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 2 new PRs (2 merged), 1 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topIssues.title: proposer: Propose super roots with its preimage
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body: Following up on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/18518, provide the super root preimage when creating `SuperFaultDisputeGame`s.

topIssues.title: op-challenger: Review correct trace output when next super root is not found
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body:
We have a test for the super root provider covering the intermediate steps between two super roots. The previous super root is known and the next one is not found. The test asserts that all steps should be the InvalidTransitionHash.

https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/develop/op-challenger/game/fault/trace/super/provider_test.go#L228-L240

We need to confirm this behaviour with op-program's expectations. I suspect that it should only transition to the invalid hash at the point where the first chain doesn't have sufficient data on L1 to derive the next block - so some intermediate steps might be valid.

This may work out ok for supervisor because it can return a super root for unsafe blocks (although there are potentially failure cases where the sequencer for one chain hasn't produced unsafe blocks even though other chains have safe blocks at that timestamp).

The same test is being ported to the Supernode version (https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18617) where the times we get not found may be different so will need to consider that unsafe blocks don't exist.

topPRs.title: proofs: Add provable output roots to super DGs
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
This patch updates the `SuperFaultDisputeGame` to be explicit about proving all output roots in the super root. This is accomplished by requiring proposers to provide the preimage of the super root when creating a `SuperFaultDisputeGame`.

The Super DG is then extended with a `rootClaim(uint256 _l2ChainId)` method that returns specific output roots contained in the proposal. This allows withdrawals to be proven using only an output root.

fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/18521, https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/18518

topPRs.title: op-deployer: Ignore max-code-size limits during deployment
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
This patch solves a major UX issue where contract developers cannot deploy a devnet using forge lite builds (`just forge-build-dev`). Previously, developers had to run full optimized builds (`just forge-build`) before running op-e2e and acceptance tests, which significantly slows down the development cycle.
When contracts are compiled without optimizations (lite profile), they often exceed the 24KB code size limit. The op-deployer was enforcing this limit even for genesis deployments, causing deployment scripts and their deployed contracts to fail with "max code size exceeded" errors.

To solve this, this patch adds a `WithNoMaxCodeSize()` option to the script Host that disables code size enforcement. This option is automatically applied to `DeploymentTargetGenesis` deployments, allowing unoptimized contracts to be deployed during devnet setup.

Note that this change only affects local development and genesis deployments. Production deployments should still enforce the 24KB limit.

topPRs.title: op-program: Reduce disk usage of preimage prestate builds in ci
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
The `preimage-reproducibility` job fails in CI because prestate builds generate too much docker build artifacts.
This patch fixes the CI build by deleting unused docker artifacts while the `preimage-reproducibility` job is running. The docker prune is done occasionally to allow for some cached artifact reuse.

topPRs.title: chore: add just recipes for devnet-up and devnet-down
topPRs.author: Olexandr88
topPRs.body:
Adds `just devnet-up` and `just devnet-down` for easier local devnet start/stop using Docker Compose
